channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024020717
item.description:
Report X-2024020717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packages was brought back to the station damaged and leaking. Package was bagged and placed in a hazmat tote and brought to the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid of the can appears to be dented and product leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was bagged and placed in a hazmat tote and brought to the damaged hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020329
item.description:
Report X-2024020329

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DROPPED WHILE LOADING AT IC AREA. HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN NOTIFIED OF DAMAGED HAZMAT PACAKGE. DescribePack: IMPACT CAUSED BOTTLE TO LEAK FROM VENTED CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE REORIENTED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024020635
item.description:
Report X-2024020635

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCIVERED LEAKING POWDER/GRANULE CONTENTS OUT OF THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE OUTER PACKAGING. UPON INSPECTION, THE BOTTOM SIDE WALL OF THE INNER CANNISTER, A PLASTIC BUCKET WITH LID, HAD SPLIT DUE TO DROP DAMAGE. DROP WAS NOT WITNESSED HOWEVER IS EVIDENT FROM THE CRUSH DAMAGE ON THE CORNER OF THE OUTER PACKAGING. DescribePack: INNER SEAL OF THE SIDE WALL OF THE PLASTIC BUCKET SPLIT AT THE BASE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO RED TOTE IMMEDIATELY UPON NOTICING SPILLAGE

Report X-2024020398

  • City: SPARTANBURG

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DROPPED WHILE LOADING AS A RESULT OF HANDLE HOLES TEARING. HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN NOTIFIED OF DAMAGED HAZMAT PACAKGE. DescribePack: BOTTLE LEAKED FROM UNDER CAP AND PUNCTURED TOP OF BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE PLACED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024020342
item.description:
Report X-2024020342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND NEAR THE 400 BELT AREA. IT APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN LEAKING OR WET FROM ANOTHER DAMAGE. I INSPECTED THE PACKAGE AND CONCLUDED THAT IT WAS A SMALL LEAK AND IT WAS COMING OUT OF THE BOTTLE ON TO THE BOX. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILURE WAS IN THE CLOSURE, THE CLOSURE WAS NOT TIGHT ENOUGH FOR TRANSPORT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HWPA AND PLACED IN A LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024020206
item.description:
Report X-2024020206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered damaged by the ISP driver inside their truck prior to their dispatch. The driver placed the package back under the belt not touching any other packages. The senior admin on duty noticed the damaged hazmat and safely placed it in a lined hazmat bin. After that the complete item was placed in the hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: There was a loose lid on one of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged was placed in a lined hazmat bin.

item.title: Report I-2024020020
item.description:
Report I-2024020020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-15
  • City: Greenville
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tote tank was loaded on trailer for delivery to consignee. Driver noticed the tote was leaking from the side of the container when shipment was being unloaded. Upon removal from trailer it was discovered that plastic bladder had split at the seam.
